intro: Langsdorffia heterotepala, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The species is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
